cards.name: Angelic Chorus
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor: The harmony of the glorious is a dirge to the wicked.

rulings.text: This does not trigger on a permanent being turned into a creature. That is just a permanent changing type, not something entering the battlefield.
Angelic Chorus does not trigger when creatures phase in or change controllers.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Ballista Squad
cards.text: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: The perfect antidote for a tightly packed formation.

cards.name: Bandage
cards.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Life is measured in inches. To a healer, every one of those inches is precious.

rulings.text: You draw the card when Bandage resolves, not when the damage is actually prevented.

cards.originalText:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Beacon of Immortality
cards.text: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: The cave floods with light. A thousand rays shine forth and meld into one.

rulings.text: If you double a negative life total, you do the real math. A life total of -10 becomes -20.
Beacon of Immortality’s effect counts as life gain (or life loss, if the life total was negative) for effects that trigger on or replace life gain (or life loss).
If a Beacon is countered or doesn’t resolve, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.

cards.name: Condemn
cards.text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now!"
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

rulings.text: The affected creature’s last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.

cards.originalText: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Demystify
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Illusion is a crutch for those with no grounding in reality."
—Cho-Manno
cards.originalText: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Field Marshal
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: He is the only one who sees the patterns in the overlapping maps and conflicting reports.

cards.text: Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Ghost Warden
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I thought of fate as an iron lattice, intricate but rigidly unchangeable. That was until some force bent fate's bars to spare my life."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Glorious Anthem
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Hail of Arrows
cards.text: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

rulings.text: You choose how the damage will be divided among the target creatures at the time you cast Hail of Arrows. Each target must be dealt at least 1 damage. If any of those creatures becomes an illegal target before Hail of Arrows resolves, the division of damage among the remaining creatures doesn’t change.

cards.originalText: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.

cards.name: Heart of Light
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.name: Heart of Light
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: For those who reach enlightenment, violence is an unnecessary distraction.

cards.name: High Ground
cards.text: Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.
cards.flavor: In war, as in society, position is everything.

rulings.text: High Ground’s effect is cumulative. If you have a creature that can already block an additional creature, now it can block three creatures.

High Ground allows you to make some complicated blocks. For example, if you’re being attacked by three creatures (call them A, B, and C) and you control three creatures (X, Y, and Z), you can have X block A and B, Y block B and C, and Z block just C, among many other possible options. The defending player chooses how each blocking creature’s combat damage will be divided among the creatures it’s blocking.

cards.originalText: Each creature you control can block an additional creature.

cards.name: Holy Day
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Today there is feasting and peace across our land, but the war has not ended. Tuck away your bloodlust. You'll need it tomorrow."
—Karrim, Samite healer
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Icatian Priest
cards.text: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Grelden knelt and felt the cool, dry hand of the priest on his brow. Hours later, when his wits returned, he was covered in his enemies' blood on the field of victory.
cards.originalText: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
cards.text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
cards.flavor: Upon the frozen tundra stand the Kjeldoran Royal Guard, pikes raised, with the king's oath upon their lips.

rulings.text: If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won’t be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

cards.originalText: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.

cards.name: Loxodon Mystic
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: Elder mystics take their vow of silence so seriously that they impose it on any who enter their presence.
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Loyal Sentry
cards.text: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.
cards.flavor: "My cause is simple: To stop you, at any cost, from ever seeing the inside of this keep."

rulings.text: Loyal Sentry and the creature it blocks are destroyed before combat damage is dealt. The blocked creature is destroyed even if Loyal Sentry leaves the battlefield before its triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.

cards.name: Luminesce
cards.text: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.

cards.name: Nomad Mythmaker
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to a creature you control.
cards.flavor: On the wild steppes, history vanishes in the dust. Only the mythmakers remain to say what was, and is, and will be.

rulings.text: You don’t choose which creature the Aura will enter the battlefield attached to until the ability resolves. You must choose a creature the Aura can legally enchant. (For example, you can’t choose a creature with protection from black if the targeted Aura card is black.) If you don’t control any creatures that the Aura can enchant, it remains in the graveyard.
Nomad Mythmaker’s ability can target an Aura card in any graveyard, not just yours.

cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card in a graveyard into play attached to a creature you control. (You control that Aura.)

cards.name: Nomad Mythmaker
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to a creature you control.

rulings.text: You don’t choose which creature the Aura will enter the battlefield attached to until the ability resolves. You must choose a creature the Aura can legally enchant. Nomad Mythmaker’s ability can target an Aura card in any graveyard, not just yours.

cards.name: Pariah
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

rulings.text: You can attach this to an opponent’s creature, and all damage done to you is instead done to their creature.

All damage being dealt to you at one time gets redirected to one Pariah. If you take 3 damage at once, all 3 damage goes to one Pariah. If you take damage from multiple creatures in combat, all the combat damage goes to one Pariah.

Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)

All damage being dealt to you at one time gets redirected to one Pariah. If you take 3 damage at once, all 3 damage goes to one Pariah. If you take damage from multiple creatures in combat, all the combat damage goes to one Pariah.

Flying

cards.flavor: "You have not died until I consent."

Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

rulings.text: A “blocking creature” is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

cards.originalText: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rule of Law
cards.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
cards.flavor: Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.

rulings.text: Rule of Law looks at the entire turn to see if a player has cast a spell, even if Rule of Law wasn’t on the battlefield when that spell was cast. Notably, you can’t cast Rule of Law and then cast another spell during the same turn.
If you cast a spell that was countered, you can’t cast another spell during the same turn.

cards.originalText: Each player can't play more than one spell each turn.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Take the deadly grace and strength of the leonin, combined with a pteron mount capable of rending a foe in two and armed with notched steel. That is a skyhunter—and why Taj-Nar has never fallen."

cards.name: Soul Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other’s ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature comes into play, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

rulings.text: The triggered ability triggers when the enchanted creature deals any damage, not only combat damage.

Unlike the lifelink ability, the ability of Spirit Link is a triggered ability that goes on the stack and may be responded to. Notably, if the enchanted creature deals damage at the same time you’re dealt enough damage to reduce your life total to 0 or less, you’ll lose the game before you can gain any life.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

rulings.text: The triggered ability triggers when the enchanted creature deals any damage, not only combat damage.

Unlike the lifelink ability, the ability of Spirit Link is a triggered ability that goes on the stack and may be responded to. Notably, if the enchanted creature deals damage at the same time you’re dealt enough damage to reduce your life total to 0 or less, you’ll lose the game before you can gain any life.

cards.name: Voice of All
cards.text:
Flying
As Voice of All enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
As Voice of All comes into play, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color. (It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything of the chosen color.)

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: The air hummed with the scissoring sound of uncounted blades that hovered in front of the invaders as though wielded by a phalanx of unseen hands.
cards.originalText: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Warrior's Honor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The day will come when the righteous warrior faces a battle she cannot win. She will greet that day as she has any other."
—Asmira, holy avenger

rulings.text: Warrior’s Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won’t get the bonus.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"I abandoned my dream of a squadron of griffin-riders when the cost proved too high. Three trainers were eaten for every griffin broken to the bridle."
—King Darien of Kjeldor
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Windborn Muse
cards.text:
Flying
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is justice, clear and relentless."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

rulings.text: Creatures may still attack planeswalkers you control without their controller paying a cost.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.

cards.name: Youthful Knight
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: Idealism fits him better than his armor.
cards.originalText: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Youthful Knight
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: Idealism fits him better than his armor.

cards.name: Academy Researchers
cards.text: When Academy Researchers enters the battlefield, you may put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers.
cards.flavor: They brandish their latest theories as warriors would wield weapons.

rulings.text: You can’t put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield this way if that Aura can’t legally enchant Academy Researchers. For example, you can’t put an Aura with “enchant land” or “enchant green creature” onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers (unless Academy Researchers somehow turned into a land or a green creature before the ability resolved).

cards.originalText: When Academy Researchers comes into play, you may put an Aura card from your hand into play attached to Academy Researchers.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, *The Mirror of the Sea*
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Ambassador Laquatus
cards.text: {3}: Target player mills three cards.
cards.flavor: "Life is a game. The only thing that matters is whether you're a pawn or a player."
cards.originalText: {3}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
cards.text:
{T}: Draw three cards.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "Do not concern yourself with my origin, my race, or my ancestry. Seek my record in the pits, and then make your wager."

rulings.text: Arcanis’s last ability can be activated only while it’s on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Draw three cards.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Aura Graft
cards.text: Gain control of target Aura that's attached to a permanent. Attach it to another permanent it can enchant.
cards.flavor: "It's not really stealing. It's more like extended borrowing."

rulings.text: If there is no legal place to move the enchantment, then it doesn’t move but you still control it.
Aura Graft’s effect has no duration. You’ll retain control of the Aura until the game ends, the Aura leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of the Aura.
You can target an Aura you already control just to move that Aura to a new permanent.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target Aura that's attached to a permanent. Attach it to another permanent it can enchant.

cards.text:

cards.flavor: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
